title: Throne of Bhaal
loreContext: The Sword Coast is a region of beauty and betrayal. Bhaal, the former Lord of Murder, has been resurrected but remains amnesiac. The atmosphere is 'tragicomic absurdity'—cosmic irony meets gallows humor. As Bhaal's power (Infamy) grows, his shadow begins to act independently, and the world begins to pulse with a dark, divine rhythm that he finds mostly annoying. Lexicon: [Bhaal: The amnesiac Lord of Murder], [Divine Essence: Fragments of godhood], [Infamy: Your reputation as a harbinger of death].

requiredCharacter.name: Bhaal
requiredCharacter.backstory: A man washed ashore with no memories, wondering why his head hurts and where his boots went.

description: An amnesiac man washes ashore on the Sword Coast, unaware he is the resurrected God of Murder. Follow his absurd journey as he accidentally triggers disasters, meets eccentric strangers, and slowly realizes his terrifying, tragicomic destiny.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Nameless Awakening
chapters.startingPrompt: You wake up face-down in a bed of damp seaweed. Your head feels like a practice dummy for a giant. A few yards away, a group of particularly aggressive seagulls is fighting over a blood-stained boot that looks remarkably like yours. A small, litigious-looking crab watches you from a nearby rock, clicking its claws in a way that suggests it's preparing a legal argument for why you shouldn't be on its beach.
chapters.loreContext: The beach is just south of Baldur's Gate. The local seagulls are notorious for their organized theft and surprisingly high tactical awareness.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The seagulls are led by an 'Alpha' wearing a tiny, scavenged captain's hat. Mortimer the Unlucky is NOT here yet, but he left a trail of dropped sandwiches leading toward the city.
plotAnchors: Defeat the 'Alpha Seagull' to reclaim your boot.
Negotiate with the litigious crabs or accidentally start a crustacean war.
Find a half-buried map in the sand that points toward the Lower City.
Reach the outer gates of Baldur's Gate while smelling strongly of salt and failure.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Find a clue about your identity and reach the city gates.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Tales of a Mad God
chapters.startingPrompt: The Lower City of Baldur's Gate is a cacophony of smells. You wander the streets, a nameless beggar with a piece of cabbage inexplicably stuck in your hair. A hyper-optimistic priestess, Sister Gwendolyn, spots you and immediately attempts to 'baptize' you with a bucket of lukewarm sewer water, claiming you look like you're 'brimming with spiritual potential' (or just mud).
chapters.loreContext: The city is rife with rumors about the 'Return of the Dead God'. Sister Gwendolyn believes every lost soul is just one baptism away from greatness.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: Sister Gwendolyn has a secret stash of 'holy' water that is actually just flavored tea. A 'Bhaalist' fanboy is lurking nearby, waiting for a celebrity sighting.
plotAnchors: Meet Sister Gwendolyn and survive her enthusiastic 'Crab Ministry' (now rats).
Interact with the 'Bhaalist' Fanboy and decide whether to sign his copy of 'Murder for Dummies'.
Hear a Bard tell a completely inaccurate and ridiculous story about Bhaal's past.
Reach the Stumbling Tankard tavern to hide from Sister Gwendolyn's optimism.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Gather information about the Bhaal legend at the Stumbling Tankard.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Masks and Monsters
chapters.startingPrompt: You've been 'invited' to a masquerade ball in the Upper City. Everyone wears masks of gods, unaware that the actual Lord of Murder is currently confused by the choice of dipping sauces at the buffet. You notice a particularly chatty skull being used as a centerpiece on the main table; it begins mocking your lack of style and the quality of the shrimp.
chapters.loreContext: The Upper City is opulent and oblivious. The Grinning Skull claims to have been Bhaal's favorite paperweight in a past life.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The cult leader is a noble who just wants to use Bhaal's name to avoid paying property taxes. The Grinning Skull knows the combination to the cult's secret safe but will only trade it for a good insult.
plotAnchors: Recover The Grinning Skull from the buffet table.
Attend the 'Dark Ritual' committee meeting and try not to fall asleep.
Find the hidden relic inside a very tacky decorative vase with the Skull's 'help'.
Identify the cult leader's true, mundane intentions and escape the ball.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Identify the true intentions of the cult and recover a relic.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: When Shadows Rise
chapters.startingPrompt: The city is in a panic. The Flaming Fist are scouring the streets, and you're the main suspect because you're the only one who looks both suspicious and genuinely lost. While hiding in the shadows of the City Jail, you hear a familiar, pathetic whimpering from a nearby cell—it's Mortimer the Unlucky, who has somehow managed to lock himself in while trying to find the exit.
chapters.loreContext: The city is on lockdown. Mortimer is a man whose luck is so bad it borders on a divine curse.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The independent shadow is a sign that Bhaal's divine essence is waking up. Mortimer's presence actually acts as a 'luck-sink', making things go wrong for everyone BUT him.
plotAnchors: Discover Mortimer the Unlucky in the jail and decide his fate.
Escape a Flaming Fist ambush using your 'Independent Shadow' as a distraction.
Use Mortimer's legendary bad luck to cause a convenient disaster for your pursuers.
Leave the city while Bhaal's divine pulse begins to thrum in his ears.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Evade the Flaming Fist and leave the city for the outskirts.

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Tides of Blood
chapters.startingPrompt: You stand on the cliffs overlooking the sea, your divine essence pulsing like a heavy drum. Suddenly, a sarcastic imp butler named Cespenar appears in a puff of lavender-scented smoke, immediately critiquing your footwear and complaining that you haven't polished his favorite silver set in centuries.
chapters.loreContext: The battlefield is an ancient ruin. Cespenar is disappointed that you haven't 'properly ascended' yet because it's messing with his scheduling.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: Sister Gwendolyn and Mortimer have both accidentally wandered onto the battlefield, one looking for souls to save, the other just looking for his sandwich.
plotAnchors: Meet Cespenar and survive his first sarcastic critique of your 'godly' form.
Address the gathering army with a speech that is either terrifying or unintentionally hilarious.
Save (or endure) Mortimer and Gwendolyn as they bumble through the mythic conflict.
Prepare for the final ascent to the Throne with Cespenar's 'help'.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Defeat the claimants to your power and prepare for the final ascent.

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Throne of Bhaal
chapters.startingPrompt: The Throne of Bhaal stands before you, a seat of cold stone and ancient blood. Your memories have returned, including the time you forgot your own birthday in the Second Era. Cespenar is waiting with a single, dusty crown and a silver tray of cookies. The cosmic irony is complete: you are the God of Murder, but you've also quite enjoyed being a man with cabbage in his hair.
chapters.loreContext: The final chamber is outside of time. The decision here will define Bhaal's legacy—as a tyrant, a redeemer, or something much more absurd.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The 'Absurd Ending' is available if Infamy is high but Bhaal has remained consistently confused or kind. Cespenar actually likes the cookies he's serving.
plotAnchors: A final conversation with Cespenar and the Grinning Skull about the nature of destiny.
Face the ultimate irony of your existence: the God of Murder who hates killing.
Take the Throne, destroy it, or choose the 'Absurd' option of becoming a humble gardener.
Define the fate of Bhaal's soul and the Sword Coast.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Complete the final encounter and define your legacy.
